description.narrative: ECOWAS Trade Negotiation Capåcity Building - TNCB - Phase II. The project shall contribute to increased capacity in the area of trade policy in ECOWAS' mamber states and in ECOWAS' secretariate and thus support regional integration. Expected results are: Common External Tariff implemented, ECOWAS' Trade Policy developed, Inter-Insttutional Committees established in Member Countries.

ECOWAS-Trade Negitiation Capacity Building - TNCB - Phase II. Projectet skall bidra till ökad kapacitet inom det handelspolitiska området i ECOWAS' medlemsländer och inom ECOWAS' sekretariat och härigenom främja regional integraton. Förväntade resultat är: Common External Tariff genomförd, ECOWAS' Trade Policy utarbetad, Inter-Institutional Committees uppbyggda i medlemsländerna.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The first result is strengthening the inter-institutional committees for multilateral trade and enabling them to function in all member countries. This output have been acheived through the Joint Integrated Technical Assistance Programme (JITAP) and facilitation of the process of establishing the committees by designing relevant legal instruments, identifying and inviting stakeholders, meeting with management of trade departments, identifying consultants and organising briefing meetings with external stakeholders. In addition, the project has supported the functioning of the secretariats of the committees by purchasing some ICT equipment such as laptops, desktops, and hard drives. The second output of the project is the establishment of Common External Tariff (CET) which was finalised and notified to WTO. This was as a result of technical assistance provided by the project to enhance awareness through various capacity building workshop . The third result achieved by the project is the development of ECOWAS trade policy. On the other hand, the project provided support to ECOWAS Trade Directorate through the provision of technical assistance in the form of project staff, producing research and briefing papers, organising seminars on trade-related issues for the ECOWAS Commission and performing in-house training in regional economic integration, trade and customs management. Some of the activities implemented and contributed for the achieviement of the outputs were training on Trade Policy for ECOWAS officials, Court of Justice, consultants and ECOWAS Parliament. Representatives from ECOWAS Member States also participated at the workshop, which was facilitated by experts from the WTO.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
